result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant in custody.    
Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.   Initial appearance is reset to 03-21-22 at 2:15 p.m.    Bail is set at $1,500.00 recognizance bond.   
Minutes.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 21, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

Order for Contempt.
The court finds the defendant in contempt of court.  As a result of this finding, the court sentences the defendant to seven (7) days in the Manitowoc County Jail.  The initial appearance in this matter is hereby adjourned to 03-14-22 at 1:30 p.m. in Branch 3.

3:20 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Justin L. Smith appeared by video, in custody at Manitowoc County Jail.  The defendant was not cooperating with the court and not answering his questions.  The Court finds the defendant in contempt and imposes seven (7) days in the county jail.  Court will draft order.
Initial appearance scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
